com.impinj.octanesdk

Class PlacementConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.impinj.octanesdk.PlacementConfig

  • public class PlacementConfig
extends Object
    Since xArray reports location, it requires knowledge of its exact placement, especially when there are multiple xArrays reporting location and the user requires a consistent coordinate system.
    Author:
    impinj

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlacementConfig() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFacilityXLocationCm()
      When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide.
      int getFacilityYLocationCm()
      When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide.
      short getHeightCm()
      The xArray needs to know its height above ground level to perform location calculations.
      short getOrientationDegrees()
      When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide.
      void setFacilityXLocationCm(int facilityXLocationCm)
      When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide.

      When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide.

      The xArray needs to know its height above ground level to perform location calculations.
      void setOrientationDegrees(short orientationDegrees)

    • Method Detail

      • getHeightCm

        public short getHeightCm()
        The xArray needs to know its height above ground level to perform location calculations. The default value is 457 cm
        Returns:
        the current height of the xArray

      • setHeightCm

        public void setHeightCm(short heightCm)
        The xArray needs to know its height above ground level to perform location calculations. The default value is 457 cm
        Parameters:
        heightCm - the height of the xarray

      • getFacilityXLocationCm

        public int getFacilityXLocationCm()
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero
        Returns:
        the current value for the xArray facility x coordinate

      • setFacilityXLocationCm

        public void setFacilityXLocationCm(int facilityXLocationCm)
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero
        Parameters:
        facilityXLocationCm - the desired value for the xArray facility x coordinate

      • getFacilityYLocationCm

        public int getFacilityYLocationCm()
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero
        Returns:
        the current value for the xArray facility y coordinate

      • setFacilityYLocationCm

        public void setFacilityYLocationCm(int facilityYLocationCm)
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero
        Parameters:
        facilityYLocationCm - the desired value for the xArray facility y coordinate

      • getOrientationDegrees

        public short getOrientationDegrees()
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero . Range is -180 to 180 degrees
        Returns:
        the orientation of the xArray in degrees

      • setOrientationDegrees

        public void setOrientationDegrees(short orientationDegrees)
        When operating multiple xArrays in a single facility, a common coordinate system is desirable across all xArrays so that location data can be interpreted store-wide. The default value is zero. Range is -180 to 180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        orientationDegrees - the desired orientation of the xArray in degrees
